data.title: OJHL alum Will Acton named Pro Scout by Pittsburgh Penguins
data.text:
Photo: Metroland Media & NHL.com

PITTSBURGH, PA. - The Pittsburgh Penguins have hired former Stouffville Spirit forward Will Acton as a professional scout.

Actonâ€™s hiring was one of several appointments made by manager Ron Hextall today.

Acton, 33, joins the Penguins organization as a pro scout after a nine-year professional career split between the National Hockey League, American Hockey League and DEL, Germany's top professional league.

Acton played for the Stouffville Spirit of the Ontario Junior Hockey League for three seasons, including a run to the league final in 2006. He represented the OJHL on Team Canada East at the World Jr. A Hockey Championships in 2006.

He then played for years for the NCAA Division I Lake Superior State Lakers in Sault Ste. Marie, Mich.

The lifelong Stouffville resident recorded five points (3G-2A) in 33 career NHL games with the Edmonton Oilers and finished out his playing career in Germany from 2015-20.

Acton is the son of 14-year NHL veteran and former NHL coach Keith Acton. He was born in the Twin Cities when he father played for the Minnesota North Stars.

With the Penguins, Acton will scout players in the NHL and AHL, and report to director of professional scouting Ryan Bowness.
